As a: This is a play on words where "acres" is pronounced the same as "assured." The phrase could be interpreted as "I'm not surprised you're struggling; it's always been your assured point."
I'm not surprised you're struggling; it's always been your weakest link.
I'm not surprised you're struggling; it's always been your Achilles' heel.
I'm not surprised you're struggling; it's always been your weakest link.
I'm not surprised you're struggling; it's always been your weakest point.
